document.docAuthor: Qiu, Jian-Yue, Xu, Hao & Chen, Li
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic review of the Oriental flower beetle Coilodera penicillata species complex (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Cetoniinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic review of the Oriental flower beetle Coilodera penicillata species complex (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Cetoniinae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Macronota dives var. mearesi (Westwood)
:
Schaum 1848 : 27
(treated as a variety);
Schaum 1849 : 262
.

Macronota penicillata var. mearesi (Westwood)
:
Arrow 1910 : 45
(treated as a variety);
Janson 1917 : 109
(on the type series).

Coilodera mearesi (Westwood)
:
Nakane 1972 : 113
(raised to species rank), figs. 1 (parameres), 7 (habitus);
Krajčík 1998 : 88
;
Sakai & Nagai 1998 : 357
(northeastern India), plate. 136, figs. 1624-1 ♂, 1624-2 ♀.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Body length 20.0–21.9 mm; width 9.0–11.4 mm. This species is very similar to
Coilodera dives
, but it can be distinguished by the following characters: tomentum on body surface lemon-yellow; head, pronotum, and protibiae with green metallic reflections ( Figs. 10–13 , 42–43 ); posterior margin of the median tomentose area of pronotum always curved in both sexes; pronotal ridges usually slightly wider; median portion of abdomen with sparse, long setae in some individuals ( Figs. 11 , 43 ; absent in Fig. 12 ); parameres flatter in lateral view ( Fig. 78 ).

Type material. Syntype : 1♀ (OXUM), Khills [handwritten on pale yellow label] / Meares Parry [handwritten on red label] / TYPE COL: 715, Macronota mearesii Westw. , HOPE DEPT. OXFORD [species name handwritten on red label with a black border] ( Figs. 42–44 ).

Comments on type material.
The original description of
Macronota mearesii
is based on an unspecified number of female specimens provided by British entomologist Frederic J. S. Parry ( Westwood 1842 ). Schaum (1849) have examined more of conspecific specimens from the Parry’s collection and these specimens were later purchased by Mr. R. Oberthür ( Janson 1917 ). It is difficult to locate and verify all potential types , and here we only examined one female type from OXUM .

Other material examined (58♂♂, 50♀♀). 1♀ (BMNH, Bourgoin Coll.), Coll. Nonfried, Hymalaya;
1♀ ( MSNG ), Imalaja, Dohrn 80.

CHINA : Xizang :
5.VIII.2017
, Mount Qomolangma Nature Reserve , Zhangmu , Nyalam County , 27°58'36.82"N , 85°58'25"E ,
2,100 m
, Jian-Yue Qiu & Hao Xu.
Distribution. Nepal ; northeastern India ; China ( new record ).

Natural history. This species inhabit the mountainous along the south side of Himalaya, and adult visit the flower of
Viburnum mullaha Buchanan-Hamilton ex Don
( Adoxaceae ) (or near) ( Figs. 95–97 ).

Remarks.
Coilodera mearesii
was regarded as a variety of
C. penicillata
( Schaum 1848 , 1849 ; Arrow 1910 ), and it was resurrected to species level simultaneously by Mikšić (1972) and Nakane (1972) . This species was reported from northern India , Sikkim , and Nepal ( Mikšić 1972 ; Nakane 1972 ; Sakai & Nagai 1998 ) where is sympatric with
C. penicillata
( Fig. 85 ).
Coilodera mearesii
can be separated from congeners by the differences on scutellum, mesometasternal suture, outer tooth of metatibia, and male genitalia. It is believed that the records from Fujian of southeastern China ( Ma 1995 , 2002b ) was based on the misidentification for
C. nigroscutellaris
, and here we recorded
Coilodera mearesii
from China for the first time.
